ingredient_list.text: 1.5kg lamb shoulder, from a young lamb

method.text: 1-2 days in advance of cooking, salt the lamb with 1.25% salt by weight of lamb, e.g. 19g salt for 1.5kg lamb shoulder
Leave the lamb out for a couple of hours before cooking to come up to temperature
Put in a roasting dish, with 600ml warm water, slashing the thickest part of the meat a few times about 1cm deep
Start in the oven at 130C (no fan) and cook 45 minutes each side
Raise the temp to 160C and cook 45 minutes each side
Take the lamb out of the oven, and let the temperature heat up to 250C

Put something under the bone end of the lamb to raise it well up off the tray - this will allow all the skin to brown. When the oven is up to temperature, put the lamb back in and cook briefly until the crust is deep brown

notes.text: Try not slashing meat next time, to see it it's really necessary
